    Ãƒâ€º                                                                   Ãƒâ€º                               
    Ãƒâ€º         Sequel to Ubisoft&#039;s original Splinter Cell                Ãƒâ€º

    Ãƒâ€º          to take the light-and-shadow-based                       Ãƒâ€º

    Ãƒâ€º          everything about it. Lead character Sam                  Ãƒâ€º                                                
    Ãƒâ€º          Fisher has an all-new set of moves at his                Ãƒâ€º                                                
    Ãƒâ€º          disposal, including being able to climb                  Ãƒâ€º                                                
    Ãƒâ€º          higher after a split jump and a SWAT                     Ãƒâ€º                                                
    Ãƒâ€º          move across open doorways, and weapons                   Ãƒâ€º                                                
    Ãƒâ€º          have secondary functions. There are also                 Ãƒâ€º                                                
    Ãƒâ€º          plenty of new gadgets, including new vision              Ãƒâ€º                                                
    Ãƒâ€º          modes, sonar devices, motion sensors, and                Ãƒâ€º                                                
    Ãƒâ€º          secondary fire modes for his weapons. But                Ãƒâ€º                                                
    Ãƒâ€º          the biggest upgrade comes in the form of a               Ãƒâ€º                                                
    Ãƒâ€º         multiplayer mode that divides players into two            Ãƒâ€º                                                
    Ãƒâ€º          teams: spies and mercenaries, each with specific         Ãƒâ€º                                                
    Ãƒâ€º          gear, abilities and parameters.                          Ãƒâ€º
